title: Revolutionary War Airports (1770s)
summary: During July 4th Lincoln Memorial speech, Trump claimed Continental Army 'took over the airports' in the Revolutionary War. Wright Brothers' first flight wasn't until 1903 - over 125 years later.
keyFacts: July 4, 2019: Lincoln Memorial speech claimed Continental Army 'took over the airports' in the Revolutionary War
Full quote: 'Our Army manned the air, it rammed the ramparts, it took over the airports, it did everything it had to do'
Wright Brothers' first flight: 1903 - over 125 years after the Revolutionary War ended
First commercial airport: College Park, Maryland, 1909
Also confused Revolutionary War (1775-1783) with War of 1812, referencing Fort McHenry (1814)
